managers.name: Scott McKenzie
managers.signature: Unprecedented eight Division 1 titles and remarkable four-peat (S9-S12)
managers.story: In the annals of Top 100 history, no name commands more respect than Scott McKenzie. With an unprecedented eight Division 1 titles, the Barcelona legend has established a record that may never be equalled. From his early triumphs in Seasons 2 and 3 to the remarkable four-peat of Seasons 9-12, McKenzie's tactical brilliance and unwavering consistency have defined an era.

achievements.name: Four-peat Champion
achievements.description: S9-S12 consecutive Division 1 titles - a feat unmatched in Top 100 history

managers.name: Glen Mullan
managers.signature: The community pillar who embodies everything Top 100 stands for
managers.story: Glen Mullan represents the heart of what makes Top 100 special. As Espanyol's longest serving manager with 300+ games, he has transformed the club from life support to Division 1 regulars. Known as Top 100's standard bearer for activity, Glen consistently defies relegation predictions through tactical discipline and never-say-die attitude.

achievements.name: 300 Games Milestone
achievements.description: Longest serving Espanyol manager in Top 100 history

achievements.name: Against All Odds S24
achievements.description: Kept team in Division 1 when predicted to go down

achievements.name: Miracle Promotion S23
achievements.description: Promoted to Division 1 despite being favourites for relegation from D2 to D3

managers.name: David Marsden
managers.signature: The administrator-manager ensuring fair play across Top 100
managers.story: David Marsden holds a unique position in Top 100 history as both active manager and primary rule enforcer. For 25 seasons, he has served as the administrative backbone, handling everything from transfer disputes to Youth Cup eligibility while maintaining his own managerial career. His balanced approach and commitment to fair play has enabled Top 100's growth into a thriving community.

achievements.name: S25 Youth Cup Crackdown
achievements.description: Led administrative action against five clubs for squad eligibility violations

achievements.name: Transfer Rule Framework
achievements.description: Established standardized reporting procedures and private dispute resolution

managers.name: André Libras-Boas
managers.signature: Building the modern Hellas Verona dynasty with 4 titles in 5 seasons
managers.story: André Libras-Boas represents the new face of Top 100 excellence. With four Division 1 titles in five seasons and currently leading the S25 championship race, he has built a modern dynasty at Hellas Verona. His complete success across multiple competitions demonstrates that excellence spans multiple eras, proving himself as both a tactical innovator and consistent performer.

achievements.name: Modern Dynasty
achievements.description: Leading S25 championship race, representing the current era of Top 100 excellence
